p: Triterpene glycosides isolated from rare medicinal plants often display a wide range of pharmacological activities, such as anti-inflammatory [ 21], antifungal [ 22], antimicrobial [ 23], anti-cancer [ 24], anti-diabetic [ 25] and immunomodulatory [ 26] effects. Indeed, triterpene saponins are the key active constituents of major medicinal herbs such as Panax ginseng (Araliaceae), Gynostemma pentaphyllum (Cucurbitaceae) and Glycyrrhiza uralensis (Fabaceae) [ 27, 28].
